list-item.p: Engagement: How the program maintains up to date mental models of the diversity and dynamism of needs, experiences and identities in its target communities.
Alignment: How the program picks up signals about what's happening in its policy/sector environment and uses them to better understand how it works.
Adaptation: How the program changes its approach based on mental models that are refined according to new insights from engagement and alignment.
Influence: How the program uses existing social and political processes to influence and achieve improved outcomes in both the community and the policy/sector ( 45).
